title: Establishing the White House Task Force on the 2028 Summer Olympics
summary: The document is an executive order titled 'Establishing the White House Task Force on the 2028 Summer Olympics,' issued on August 5, 2025. The order establishes a task force to coordinate federal planning and response for the 2028 Summer Olympics and Paralympics, with the President serving as Chair and the Vice President as Vice Chair. The task force includes various cabinet members and agency heads, and is housed within the Department of Homeland Security. Key functions of the task force include coordinating security, transportation, and entry/exit processes, supporting interagency cooperation, identifying and addressing barriers to effective support, assisting with visa processing and credentialing, and ensuring operational readiness across relevant functions. The task force is set to terminate on December 31, 2028, unless extended by the President. The order emphasizes the importance of the 2028 Summer Olympics as a showcase of American strength and a opportunity to welcome the world.
